title: Vladimir Nabokov - Fiction & Nonfiction (24 books)
description:
VLADIMIR NABOKOV (1899-1977) was a Russian novelist and author.  Although his first nine novels were in Russian, he rose to international prominence as a writer of English prose.  He was a finalist for the National Book Award for Fiction seven times, but never won.

LOLITA (1955) is his most famous novel and often considered his finest work in English.  It exhibits the love of intricate word play, classical allusion, and synesthetic detail characteristic of his work in general.  One of the best guides to the complexities of the novel is Alfred Appel's revised edition of THE ANNOTATED LOLITA, also included here.

In addition to a generous selection of Nabokov's novels and short fiction, this collection includes his famous autobiographical memoir (SPEAK, MEMORY); drama (the recently-published TRAGEDY OF MR. MORN); interviews and reviews (STRONG OPINIONS); and his SELECTED LETTERS.


The following books are in ePUB format -- almost exclusively retail-quality -- unless otherwise indicated:

* ADA, OR ADOR: A Family Chronicle (Vintage, 1990).

* THE ANNOTATED LOLITA (Vintage, 2011).  Revised and Updated.  Edited with Preface, Introduction, and Notes by Alfred Appel, Jr.

* BEND SINISTER (Vintage, 1990).

* THE DEFENSE (Vintage, 1990).

* DESPAIR (Vintage, 1989).

* THE ENCHANTER (Vintage, 1991).  Translated by Dmitri Nabokov.

* THE EYE (Vintage, 1990).

* THE GIFT (Vintage, 1991).  Translated by Michael Scammell with the collaboration of the author.

* GLORY (Vintage, 1991).  Translated by Dmitri Nabokov with the collaboration of the author.

* INVITATION TO BEHEADING (Vintage, 1989).  Translated by Dmitri Nabokov with the collaboration of the author.

* KING, QUEEN, KNAVE  (Vintage, 1989).  Translated by Dmitri Nabokov with the collaboration of the author.

* LAUGHTER IN THE DARK (Vintage, 1989).

* LOLITA (Vintage, 1997).

* LOOK AT THE HARLEQUINS! (Vintage, 1990).

* MARY (Vintage, 1989).  Translated by Michael Glenny with the collaboration of the author.

* PALE FIRE (Vintage, 1989). -- ePUB + PDF

* PNIN (Vintage, 1989).

* THE REAL LIFE OF SEBASTIAN KNIGHT (Vintage, 1992).

* SELECTED LETTERS, 1940-1977 (Houghton Mifflin Harcourt, 1989).  Edited by Dmitri Nabokov and Matthew J. Bruccoli.

* SPEAK, MEMORY: An Autobiography Revisited (Vintage, 1989).

* THE STORIES OF VLADIMIR NABOKOV (Vintage, 1995).

* STRONG OPINIONS (Vintage, 1990). -- PDF

* THE TRAGEDY OF MR. MORN (Knopf, 2013).  Translated by Anastasia Tolstoy and Thomas Karshan, with an Introduction by Thomas Karshan.

* TRANSPARENT THINGS (Vintage, 1989).
